verses.verse: A good name<WH8034> is better<WH2896> than fine<WH2896> perfume;<WH8081> and the day<WH3117> of death<WH4194> better than the day<WH3117> of one<WH3205>'s birth.

It is better<WH2896> to go<WH3212> to the house<WH1004> of mourning<WH60> than to go<WH3212> to the house<WH1004> of feasting:<WH4960> for<WH834> that is the end<WH5490> of all men,<WH120> and the living<WH2416> should take<WH5414> this to heart.<WH3820>
Sorrow<WH3708> is better<WH2896> than laughter;<WH7814> for by the sadness<WH7455> of the face<WH6440> the heart<WH3820> is made good.<WH3190>
The heart<WH3820> of the wise<WH2450> is in the house<WH1004> of mourning;<WH60> but the heart<WH3820> of fools<WH3684> is in the house<WH1004> of mirth.<WH8057>
It is better<WH2896> to hear<WH8085> the rebuke<WH1606> of the wise,<WH2450> than for a man<WH376> to hear<WH8085> the song<WH7892> of fools.<WH3684>
For as the crackling<WH6963> of thorns<WH5518> under a pot,<WH5518> so is the laughter<WH7814> of the fool.<WH3684> This also is vanity.<WH1892>
Surely extortion<WH6233> makes the wise man<WH2450> foolish;<WH1984> and a bribe<WH4979> destroys<WH6> the understanding.<WH3820>
Better<WH2896> is the end<WH319> of a thing<WH1697> than its beginning.<WH7225> The patient<WH750> in spirit<WH7307> is better<WH2896> than the proud<WH1362> in spirit.<WH7307>
Don't<WH926> be hasty in your spirit<WH7307> to be angry,<WH3707> for anger<WH3708> rests<WH5117> in the bosom<WH2436> of fools.<WH3684>
Don't<WH559> say, "Why were the former<WH7223> days<WH3117> better<WH2896> than these?<WH7592>" For you do not ask wisely about this.<WH2451>
Wisdom<WH2451> is as good<WH2896> as an inheritance.<WH5159> Yes,<WH3148> it is more excellent for those who see<WH7200> the sun.<WH8121>

For wisdom<WH2451> is a defense,<WH6738> even as money<WH3701> is a defense;<WH6738> but the excellency<WH3504> of knowledge<WH1847> is that wisdom<WH2451> preserves the life<WH2421> of him who has it.<WH1167>
Consider<WH7200> the work<WH4639> of God,<WH430> for who can<WH3201> make that straight,<WH8626> which he has made crooked?<WH5791>

In the day<WH3117> of prosperity<WH2896> be joyful,<WH2896> and in the day<WH3117> of adversity<WH7451> consider;<WH7200> yes,<WH430> God has made<WH6213> the one side by side<WH5980> with the other,<WH1700> to the end that man<WH120> should not find<WH4672> out anything<WH3972> after him.<WH310>

All this have I seen<WH7200> in my days<WH3117> of vanity:<WH1892> there is<WH3426> a righteous<WH6662> man who perishes<WH6> in his righteousness,<WH6664> and there is a wicked<WH7563> man who lives long<WH748> in his evildoing.<WH7451>
Don't<WH7235> be overly righteous,<WH6662> neither make yourself overly<WH3148> wise.<WH2449> Why should you destroy yourself?<WH8074>
Don't<WH7235> be too wicked,<WH7561> neither be foolish.<WH5530> Why should you die<WH4191> before your time?<WH6256>

It is good<WH2896> that you should take hold<WH270> of this.<WH2088> Yes,<WH3240> also from that don't withdraw your hand;<WH3027> for he who fears<WH3373> God<WH430> will come forth from them all.<WH3318>
Wisdom<WH2451> is a strength<WH5810> to the wise<WH2450> man more than ten<WH6235> rulers<WH7989> who are in a city.<WH5892>
Surely there is not a righteous<WH6662> man<WH120> on earth,<WH776> who does<WH6213> good<WH2896> and doesn't<WH2398> sin.
Also don't<WH5414> take heed<WH3820> to all words<WH1697> that are spoken,<WH1696> lest you hear<WH8085> your servant<WH5650> curse you;<WH7043>
for often<WH6471> your own heart<WH3820> knows<WH3045> that you yourself have likewise cursed<WH7043> others.<WH312>
All this<WH2090> have I proved<WH5254> in wisdom.<WH2451> I said,<WH559> "I will be wise;<WH2449>" but it was far from me.<WH7350>
That which is,<WH7350> is far off and exceedingly deep.<WH6013> Who can find it out?<WH4672>

I turned<WH5437> around,<WH3820> and my heart sought to know<WH3045> and to search<WH8446> out,<WH1245> and to seek wisdom<WH2451> and the scheme<WH2808> of things,<WH3045> and to know that wickedness<WH7562> is stupidity,<WH3689> and that foolishness<WH5531> is madness.<WH1947>

I find<WH4672> more bitter<WH4751> than death<WH4194> the woman<WH802> whose heart<WH3820> is snares<WH4685> and traps,<WH2764> whose hands<WH3027> are chains.<WH612> Whoever pleases<WH2896> God<WH430> shall escape<WH4422> from her;<WH2398> but the sinner will be ensnared by her.<WH3920>
"Behold,<WH7200> I have found<WH4672> this,<WH559>" says the Preacher,<WH6953> "one<WH259> to another,<WH259> to find out<WH4672> the scheme;<WH2808>

which my soul<WH5315> still seeks;<WH1245> but I have not found.<WH4672> One<WH259> man<WH120> among a thousand<WH505> have I found;<WH4672> but I have not found<WH4672> a woman among all those.<WH802>
Behold,<WH7200> this only<WH905> have I found:<WH4672> that God<WH430> made<WH6213> man<WH120> upright;<WH3477> but they search for<WH1245> many<WH120> schemes.<WH2810>"
